title: Strictly stars who have denied being hit with the curse before revealing their romance
text:

A number of Strictly Come Dancing stars have been hit with the shows famous romance curse over the years - with many of the couples denying that they are an item before later revealing they are together.

With AJ Pritchard and Saffron Barker strongly denying having anything more than a platonic relationship - it would not be the first time that stars of the show have gone back on their word to later reveal they have succumbed to the Strictly curse.

Here is a look at Strictly stars who first played down getting up close and personal with their cast members before announcing that they are dating.

Kevin Clifton and Stacey Dooley

(Image: PA)

The couple who won the 2018 series of Strictly Come Dancing have openly gushed about eachother since announcing they were together.

This was not always the case with Stacey and Kevin denying things were hot and heavy with them when reports emerged that Stacey's then beau Sam Tucknott had suspected they were more than dance partners.

In February Stacey slammed the allegations, saying: “The truth is Kevin and I are brilliant friends and he’ll be my pal for life."

Kevin then said in an interview with The Sun, where he was asked if he ever had a romance with Strictly partner: “No, never. You’re there to do a job and get on with the dancing. That’s what it’s about.”

The pair have now confirmed they are together, with Stacey telling The Guardian: "Kev and I have decided not to go into too much detail about our private lives because you can't really indulge that and then ask for privacy.

"That's why we've turned down interviews that have offered us tens of thousands of pounds.

"What I am happy so say is Kev is amazing, I'm happy, life happens, I've got an amazing career and I'm very lucky".

Joe Sugg and Dianne Buswell

(Image: Jeff Spicer/Getty Images)

They could be hailed the cutest couple Strictly has ever seen but Joe Sugg and Dianne Buswell were not always forthright about their romance.

On an appearance on This morning, the duo were asked if they were more than pals, Joe immediately responded: "Here we go! Do you know what, it’s so nice, I’ve met such a good friend in Dianne..."

The blogger then continued: "We haven’t got time to think of anything like that! We’re so busy dancing."

The red-haired beauty and YouTube sensation then went on to confirm their romance - with a sweet post on social media - the day after the Strictly final.

Joe and Dianne seem to be smitten and going strong ever since officially announcing their relationship.

Georgia May Foote and Giovanni Pernice

(Image: PA)

Georgia May Foote was coy about Giovanni when learning to dance with him on the 2015 series of the hit show.

Throughout the series the gorgeous pair denied rumours that they were getting close away from the dance floor.

Reflecting on their relationship in 2016, Georgia opened up on the reason why she did not lift the lid on their extra-curricular acitivites.

The actress told MailOnline: "Gio is my best friend and he helped me through a lot.

"He's the best thing that has ever happened to me. I'm in a very good place now. I've got good people around me.

"It's something that just happened, I didn't get a chance to look at him that way while I was on the show. It was a friendship that blossomed."

The Italian hunk and brunette beauty called time on their relationship in August last year.

Ashley Roberts and Giovanni Pernice

(Image: Can Nguyen/REX)

Fans of Strictly know that handsome Giovanni is not adverse to dating a celebrity who he meets on the dancing show, but at first The Pussycat Dolls star slammed rumours that she and her partner were togther.

During an interview on This Morning, when pressed by host Philip Schofield on whether she was with Giovanni, she said, "Giovanni and I are friends. I'm really focused on the show. I'm passionate about getting better. It's all about the dancefloor for me. We're just friends and I'm single."

The pretty star and Strictly professional confirmed their romance in January and they often share loved-up Instagram snaps with their fans.

Gemma Atkinson and Gorka Marquez

(Image: David Fisher/REX/Shutterstock)

Gemma Atkinson and Gorka Marquez met on the 2017 series of Strictly.

When first quizzed on the romance, the Hollyoaks actress seemed to shut-down romance rumours as she shared: “I think he’s absolutely brilliant and we are getting to know each other, but for now the main focus is dancing.”

The pair, who were not partnered up together, then went on to embark a relationship which they shared with the world by announcing their union on social media on Valentine's Day.

Since them the bombshell and dancer have welcomed their first child together in July named Mia Louise on July 4.
description: Every year celebrities taking part in the BBC dancing show are subject to rumours that they are more than friends with their professional partners
